document.title: Introduction to Culinary Arts (One Credit), Adopted 2015

09009A1405054533A16F46DB8EA355B9.description: Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples.

9A6E2FEAD2E349B39049406BA89FD5EA.description: Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations.

6539151717D94591AEF46FA37F058738.description: Introduction to Culinary Arts will emphasize the principles of planning, organizing, staffing, directing, and controlling the management of a variety of food service operations. The course will provide insight into the operation of a well-run restaurant. Introduction to Culinary Arts will provide insight into food production skills, various levels of industry management, and hospitality skills. This is an entry level course for students interested in pursuing a career in the food service industry. This course is offered as a classroom and laboratory-based course.

2FA088633F374E47807B8146121CFA61.description: The Hospitality and Tourism Career Cluster focuses on the management, marketing, and operations of restaurants and other food/beverage services, lodging, attractions, recreation events, and travel-related services.

832B77189A394BA6ABA32F4A82454CE0.description: Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and succeed in current or emerging professions.

01E330635C24419DA8BEA7A2730B2DB8.description: General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 9 and 10. Recommended prerequisite: Principles of Hospitality and Tourism. Students shall be awarded one credit for successful completion of this course.
